name: 905.z5

messages.content:
The phone rings.

Oh, no - how long have you been asleep? Sure, it was a tough night, but... This is bad. This is very bad.

The phone rings.

  -----
9:05 by Adam Cadre
v1.12 (2016.0430) / Original release 2000.0103
  -----

Bedroom (in bed)
This bedroom is extremely spare, with dirty laundry scattered haphazardly all over the floor. Cleaner clothing can be found in the dresser. A bathroom lies to the south, while a door to the east leads to the living room.

On the end table are a telephone, a wallet and some keys.

The phone rings.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I am in a messy bedroom, startled awake by the ringing phone. 
THOUGHT: I need to answer that phone quickly; maybe it's important!
COMMAND: Answer phone.

messages.content:
You pick up the phone. "Hadley!" a shrill voice cries. "Hadley, haven't you even left yet?? You knew that our presentation was at nine o'clock sharp! First the thing with the printers, now this - there won't even be enough left of you for Bowman to fire once he's done with you. Now get the hell down here!!"

Click.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I just got a frantic call reminding me of a missed presentation at work, and now I'm in a hurry.
THOUGHT: I need to get ready and leave as quickly as possible to salvage this situation!
COMMAND: Get dressed.

messages.content:
[!: Noun error. (This could mean a number of things: a noun used in your command may not be present, or it may be present but not visible; it may be scenery you can't interact with; you may have specified too many indirect objects; you may have misspelled something; the list goes on.)]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: My command to get dressed was too vague, and the game couldn't process it.
THOUGHT: I need to be more specific about what I want to do.
COMMAND: Search dresser.

messages.content:
You'll have to get out of bed first.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I'm still in bed and need to get up before I can search the dresser.
THOUGHT: Getting up is the first step to getting ready; I can't afford to waste any more time!
COMMAND: Get up.

messages.content:
You get out of bed.

Bedroom
This bedroom is extremely spare, with dirty laundry scattered haphazardly all over the floor. Cleaner clothing can be found in the dresser. A bathroom lies to the south, while a door to the east leads to the living room.

On the end table are a telephone, a wallet and some keys.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I have successfully gotten out of bed and am now standing in the messy bedroom.
THOUGHT: I need to find some clean clothes quickly to make a good impression at the presentation.
COMMAND: Open dresser.

messages.content:
You open the dresser, revealing some clean clothing.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I have opened the dresser and found clean clothing inside.
THOUGHT: I should quickly choose something to wear for the presentation and put it on.
COMMAND: Take clothing.

SITUATION: I have taken the clean clothing from the dresser.
THOUGHT: Now I need to put it on quickly to make myself presentable before heading out.
COMMAND: Wear clothing.

messages.content:
[Which do you mean, the clean clothing or the soiled clothing?]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game is asking for clarification on which clothing I want to wear.
THOUGHT: I need to specify that I want to wear the clean clothing I just took.
COMMAND: Wear clean clothing.

messages.content:
You'll have to take off the soiled clothes you're wearing first.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I need to remove my soiled clothes before I can put on the clean ones.
THOUGHT: Time is of the essence! I need to hurry up and change into the clean clothing.
COMMAND: Remove soiled clothing.

messages.content:
You take off the soiled clothing.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I have successfully removed my soiled clothing and am now ready to put on the clean clothes.
THOUGHT: I should hurry and put on the clean clothing so I can get to the presentation on time.
COMMAND: Wear clean clothing.

messages.content:
It seems ridiculous to put on fresh, clean clothes when you yourself are covered with mud and dried sweat.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I can't wear the clean clothes until I clean myself up; I'm covered in mud and sweat.
THOUGHT: I need to freshen up quickly; the bathroom is just south of here.
COMMAND: Go bathroom.

messages.content:
Bathroom
This is a far from luxurious but still quite functional bathroom, with a sink, toilet and shower. The bedroom lies to the north.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I have entered the bathroom, which contains basic amenities for cleaning myself up.
THOUGHT: I should wash off quickly and maybe take a brief shower to feel refreshed before heading out.
COMMAND: Turn on shower.

messages.content:
You don't think the watch you're wearing is waterproof.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I realize that the shower might ruin my watch, so I need to consider alternative cleaning options.
THOUGHT: I can wash up quickly at the sink instead to avoid damaging my watch.
COMMAND: Use sink.

messages.content:
Only the shower has any chance of getting you clean at this point.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game insists that I need to use the shower to effectively clean myself.
THOUGHT: I'll have to risk taking the watch off and quickly shower to get ready for the presentation.
COMMAND: Remove watch.

messages.content:
You take off the gold watch.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I have removed the gold watch, freeing myself to use the shower without worrying about damaging it.
THOUGHT: Now I can quickly wash off the mud and sweat, allowing me to feel presentable for my presentation.
COMMAND: Take shower.

messages.content:
Carrying your possessions into the shower is a bad idea.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I need to leave my belongings outside the shower before I can wash up.
THOUGHT: I need to set my watch down somewhere safe and then jump into the shower quickly.
COMMAND: Place watch.

messages.content:
[!: Verb error. (This generally means that the first word of your command was not recognized.)]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: My command to place the watch wasn't recognized by the game.
THOUGHT: I need to specify where to put the watch before I can move on to taking a shower.
COMMAND: Set down watch.

messages.content:
[!: Verb error. (This generally means that the first word of your command was not recognized.)]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The command to set down the watch is still not being recognized by the game.
THOUGHT: I may need to be more straightforward, perhaps by selecting a simple action.
COMMAND: Drop watch.

SITUATION: I have successfully dropped the watch and can now focus on getting cleaned up.
THOUGHT: With the watch out of the way, it's time for a quick shower to wash off.
COMMAND: Take shower.

messages.content:
Carrying your possessions into the shower is a bad idea.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I need to ensure that I’m not carrying anything before I get into the shower.
THOUGHT: I need to make sure the watch is placed somewhere safe and then jump into the shower without any hesitation.
COMMAND: Exit bathroom.

SITUATION: The game requires specific instructions about where to go or what to do next.
THOUGHT: I need to focus on being specific; I can’t leave the bathroom without getting clean first.
COMMAND: Get back to shower.

messages.content:
[!: Noun error. (This could mean a number of things: a noun used in your command may not be present, or it may be present but not visible; it may be scenery you can't interact with; you may have specified too many indirect objects; you may have misspelled something; the list goes on.)]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The command to go back to the shower is not being understood by the game.
THOUGHT: I need to approach this in a more organized way before I can clean myself.
COMMAND: Get in shower.

messages.content:
Carrying your possessions into the shower is a bad idea.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game repeatedly insists that I shouldn't carry possessions into the shower, indicating I might still be holding something.
THOUGHT: I need to double-check if there's something still with me that I need to leave behind before showering.
COMMAND: Check inventory.

messages.content:
[!: Verb error. (This generally means that the first word of your command was not recognized.)

If you are unfamiliar with the conventions of interactive fiction, you may wish to play through the tutorial at http://adamcadre.ac/if.html - it explains how to phrase commands in a way that produces fewer errors.]

SITUATION: The command to check my inventory wasn't recognized by the game, indicating I need to refine my approach.
THOUGHT: I need to ensure I’m not holding anything before attempting to shower again.
COMMAND: Leave bathroom.

SITUATION: The game is asking for a more specific command to leave the bathroom.
THOUGHT: I should clarify that I want to go back to the bedroom before proceeding.
COMMAND: Go bedroom.

messages.content:
Bedroom
This bedroom is extremely spare, with dirty laundry scattered haphazardly all over the floor. A bathroom lies to the south, while a door to the east leads to the living room.

On the end table are a telephone, a wallet and some keys.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I am back in the bedroom, looking at the mess and realizing it's time to focus on cleaning myself.
THOUGHT: I really need to shower right now to freshen up before I miss that presentation.
COMMAND: Enter bathroom.

messages.content:
Bathroom
This is a far from luxurious but still quite functional bathroom, with a sink, toilet and shower. The bedroom lies to the north.

You can also see a gold watch here.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I have returned to the bathroom and see my gold watch on the floor.
THOUGHT: Now that I have my watch back, I can finally take a shower without distractions.
COMMAND: Remove watch.

messages.content:
(first taking the gold watch)
You're not wearing that.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game indicates I am not wearing the watch, and I need to clarify my actions regarding it.
THOUGHT: I need to quickly put the watch in a safe place, then shower.
COMMAND: Place watch on sink.

SITUATION: My command to place the watch on the sink was not recognized.
THOUGHT: I need to find a simpler way to set the watch down so I can proceed with showering.
COMMAND: Drop watch.

SITUATION: I have successfully dropped the watch on the bathroom floor.
THOUGHT: Now that the watch is out of the way, I can finally take a shower and clean myself up.
COMMAND: Take shower.

messages.content:
Carrying your possessions into the shower is a bad idea.

>

COMMAND: Leave bathroom.

COMMAND: Go north.

messages.content:
Bedroom
This bedroom is extremely spare, with dirty laundry scattered haphazardly all over the floor. A bathroom lies to the south, while a door to the east leads to the living room.

On the end table are a telephone, a wallet and some keys.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I have returned to the bedroom once again, still feeling pressured to get ready for the presentation.
THOUGHT: I need to quickly gather what I need to leave this room. Maybe I should grab my wallet and keys before heading out.
COMMAND: Take wallet and keys.

SITUATION: I have successfully taken the wallet and keys from the bedroom.
THOUGHT: Now I can head to the living room and hopefully figure out my next steps to get ready.
COMMAND: Go east.

messages.content:
Living room
The furniture isn't as carefully arranged as one might like, and it's a bit lacking in the luxuries that might make this a more pleasant place to spend an evening - no stereo, no TV, no DVD, none of that - but this living room is still nicer than most of those in this neighborhood. A kitchenette lies to the east, the bedroom to the west and the front door to the south.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I am in the living room, noticing the simplicity of the surroundings while feeling the urgency to leave.
THOUGHT: I should head out the front door and make my way to the presentation before it's too late.
COMMAND: Go south.

SITUATION: The front door is closed, and I need to open it before I can leave.
THOUGHT: I should unlock the door and get out quickly.
COMMAND: Open door.

messages.content:
[Which do you mean, the front door or the bedroom door?]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game requires clarification about which door I intend to open.
THOUGHT: I need to specify that I want to open the front door in order to leave.
COMMAND: Open front door.

SITUATION: I have successfully opened the front door, allowing access to the outside.
THOUGHT: I need to get moving quickly to make it to the presentation on time!
COMMAND: Go outside.

messages.content:
You need to clear out quickly, true, but you look like an absolute wreck - going out in this condition and drawing the inevitable bewildered stares would just be making a bad situation worse.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: I'm outside now, but I realize I still look disheveled and presentable, and I can't leave in this condition.
THOUGHT: I need to find a way to clean myself up before leaving the house; I don’t want to embarrass myself.
COMMAND: Go back inside.

SITUATION: The command to go back inside was not recognized, indicating I need to specify my action more clearly.
THOUGHT: I should clarify that I want to return to the living room first.
COMMAND: Go north.

messages.content:
That isn't a useful direction from here.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The command to go north is invalid since I'm outside, leaving me stuck in making progress.
THOUGHT: I need to find a way to clean myself up in the house before heading out again.
COMMAND: Go back inside living room.

messages.content:
[!: Noun error.

Again, if you're getting frustrated, please consider playing through the tutorial at http://adamcadre.ac/if.html.]

>

SITUATION: The game is asking for a more specific command regarding searching the living room.

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game reminds me again that I can't bring possessions into the shower, which continues to block my progress.
THOUGHT: I need to ensure that I have no items with me that may be interfering with taking a shower. 
COMMAND: Check belongings.

SITUATION: The command to check my belongings is not recognized, leaving me stuck.
THOUGHT: I should focus on ensuring that I don’t have any items affecting my ability to use the shower.
COMMAND: Drop watch.

messages.content:
The gold watch is already here.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game confirms that the gold watch is already in the bathroom, which doesn't help my situation.
THOUGHT: I likely need to ensure I have nothing else on me—I might still have my clothing on. 
COMMAND: Remove clothing.

messages.content:
[Which do you mean, the clean clothing or the soiled clothing?]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game is asking for clarification on which clothing I need to remove.
THOUGHT: I need to specify that I want to remove the soiled clothing to finally clean myself up.
COMMAND: Remove soiled clothing.

SITUATION: The game confirms that I am not wearing the soiled clothing, indicating I am still stuck.
THOUGHT: I must have missed something; I need to focus on what is preventing me from getting clean.
COMMAND: Look around.

SITUATION: The command to look around is not being recognized by the game.
THOUGHT: I need to find a clear action that will help me address the situation.
COMMAND: Check shower.

SITUATION: The command to check the shower is not recognized, leading to further frustration.
THOUGHT: I need to rethink what I can do in this location to move forward.
COMMAND: Turn on shower.

messages.content:
Carrying your possessions into the shower is a bad idea.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game continues to indicate that I cannot turn on the shower while carrying possessions.
THOUGHT: I need to clarify that I currently have nothing in my hands, yet I'm unable to shower.
COMMAND: Drop everything.

SITUATION: The command to drop everything is still not recognized, leaving me stuck in an endless loop.
THOUGHT: I need to simplify my approach and find a way to clean myself up without further complications.
COMMAND: Get in shower.

messages.content:
Carrying your possessions into the shower is a bad idea.

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game reiterates that I can't take possessions into the shower, blocking my way forward.
THOUGHT: I need to make sure I’m not holding or wearing anything at all, but I feel lost in the loop.
COMMAND: Remove clothing.

messages.content:
[Which do you mean, the clean clothing or the soiled clothing?]

>

messages.meta:
SITUATION: The game requires clarification on which clothing I am trying to remove.
THOUGHT: I need to specify that I want to remove the clean clothing since I am not wearing the soiled clothing.
COMMAND: Remove clean clothing.
